thread.title: Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny wanted by Borussia Dortmund, Napoli, Juventus and current club Roma
thread.title_full: Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny wanted by Borussia Dortmund, Napoli, Juventus and current club Roma

author: arichardson
title: Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny wanted by Borussia Dortmund, Napoli, Juventus and current club Roma
text:
Szczes' price rises Arsenal goalkeeper Wojciech Szczesny wanted by Borussia Dortmund, Napoli, Juventus and current club Roma 
Pole has impressed during two-year loan spell in Serie A and Petr Cech's erratic form could even given him Gunners chance By ANDREW RICHARDSON Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments WOJCIECH SZCZESNY will not be short of suitors when his loan deal at Roma runs out in the summer, according to reports in Italy. 
The Polish stopper is contracted to Arsenal but has spent the last two seasons at the Stadio Olimpico. Reuters 
And Gazzetta dello Sport report that his form has alerted Juventus , Napoli and Borussia Dortmund — with Roma likely to be priced out of a summer move. 
While, recent howlers by Cech could see him given a reprieve at the Emirates. 
Roma would love to keep the 26-year-old beyond the end of the season, but will not pay the £13.6million fee agreed at the beginning of the loan deal. 
In terms of guaranteed game time, Dortmund would be the most appealing to Szczesny. Getty Images Roma would like to sign Wojciech Szczesny in summer by may be priced out Related Stories Sutton boss Paul Doswell blasts Arsenal's 'bizarre James Bond’ security after FA Cup clash Class act Arsenal to donate £50,000 to help beaten FA Cup opponents Sutton build classrooms and fix the loos BARCA CALLING Barcelona add Southampton's Cedric Soares to list of right-backs they could swoop for this summer BIG MONEY SIGNING Theo Walcott signs Sutton players' shirts in dressing room after Arsenal's crushing FA Cup victory NO TIMEWASTERS PLEASE Axel Witsel's stunning wife puts their old car up for sale for £3,000... despite him earning £294,000-A-WEEK News Group Newspapers Ltd 5 Wojciech Szczesny could be keen on a return to Arsenal as their No.1 
Roman Burki is his main competition for a starting berth and he would fancy his chances of replacing the Swiss. 
A move to Juventus would almost guarantee trophies, but he would most certainly be second choice to Gianluigi Buffon . 
Should Szczesny be willing to wait patiently for the legendary Italian to hang up his gloves, he would also have to factor in the possibility of Gianluigi Donnarumma becoming available between now and then. Getty Images Wojciech Szczesny would have to compete with Gianluigi Buffon at Juventus Getty Images 5 A move to Napoli would see Wojciech Szczesny compete with Pepe Reina 
Meanwhile, at Napoli, he would have to contend with Pepe Reina , who has become somewhat of a fan favourite. 
Szczesny has made no secret of his love for Arsenal and could have the chance to reclaim his place as No.1 next season. 
Cech was brought in two seasons ago as a more reliable option, but recent erratic form has led to question marks about his long-term capabilities. 
And Szczesny could be returning at just the right time. Theo Walcott signs Sutton players’ shirts in dressing room after Arsenal FA Cup win
